items.title: South Korean shares hit record as chipmakers surge on OpenAI deal
items.summary: South Korean shares soared to a record high on Thursday, driven by a significant surge in chipmakers Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix. Both companies secured a major deal to supply memory chips for OpenAI's data centres, propelling the benchmark KOSPI over 3%.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei rises after 4 days of losses as chip-related shares jump
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei share average posted a slight gain on Thursday, ending a four-session losing streak, primarily boosted by chip-related stocks tracking U.S. peers. However, the broader Topix index declined, with analysts suggesting the Nikkei's recovery might be brief due to cautious retail investors and overall negative market sentiment.

items.title: Stocks to buy for short term: From HAL to SBI— Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking recommends THESE 3 shares
items.summary: Stocks to buy for short term: Ajit Mishra of Religare Broking shares insights on three stocks to consider for short-term gains, including HAL and SBI. Discover which sectors and stocks are poised for breakout potential.

items.title: What would Peter Lynch buy in India today? Here are three tenbagger bets.
items.summary: Peter Lynch's focus on understanding businesses and long-term vision offers a powerful framework. We reveal three potential picks and their hidden risks.

items.title: CarTrade’s fast lane: After doubling in a year, can this classifieds giant keep its edge?
items.summary: OLX-driven scale, rising margins, and a widening ecosystem have fuelled CarTrade’s rally—but competition and valuations raise tough questions.

items.title: Stock to buy in short term: Choice Broking's Sumeet Bagadia recommends this PSU stock as his Dussehra Pick
items.summary: Bharat Electronics (BEL) shares have gained 9% in the past month but dropped 6% in three months. Sumeet Bagadia predicts upward momentum, with a target price of  ₹444-480. BEL is trading at  ₹406.50, with strong technical signals and support at  ₹380.

items.title: Rupee pushed to the front in cross-border transactions
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India proposed measures to significantly boost the rupee's use in cross-border trade, particularly with neighboring countries and major partners. This includes permitting banks to lend INR to non-residents for trade and establishing direct reference rates with currencies like the Indonesian rupiah and UAE dirham. Additionally, special rupee vostro account balances will gain wider investment eligibility.

items.title: Kia targets India hybrid gap with plans for a new compact SUV
items.summary: Kia is poised to introduce a compact hybrid SUV in India within 18 months, venturing into the dual-powered vehicle segment. This strategic launch aligns with India's evolving emissions policy, which now promotes hybrid technologies. The automaker aims to capture a crucial market niche, as Japanese rivals have focused on larger models.

items.title: RBI governor signals continuity amid Tata Sons listing speculation
items.summary: RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra addressed Tata Sons' listing mandate. He stated registered entities operate until cancellation. Tata Sons missed the September 30 listing deadline. It was the only core investment company not to comply. Tata Sons applied to surrender its CIC registration last year to avoid listing. The central bank has not decided. Speculation continues on the conglomerate's future.

items.title: Wall Street closes higher, boosted by healthcare as investors shrug off jobs data, US shutdown
items.summary: Wall Street indexes closed higher Wednesday, primarily boosted by the healthcare sector following Pfizer's drug price agreement with President Trump. Investors largely overlooked weaker private payrolls data and the ongoing U.S. government shutdown, demonstrating historical market resilience. Technology stocks also contributed to gains, while the materials sector declined.

items.title: Miners, gold stocks power Australian shares higher; Wall Street gains add lift
items.summary: Australian shares surged Thursday, driven by strong performances from miners and gold stocks, buoyed by positive Wall Street sentiment. The S&P/ASX 200 index climbed 0.7%, reaching 8,906.30 points. Miners advanced 1.9% on rising copper prices, while gold stocks hit a record high, up 2.5%, amid safe-haven demand. Banks and healthcare also contributed to the broad-based gains.

items.title: Goldman Sachs' Rs 10,000 crore India portfolio: 4 stocks rally 50-155% in 1 year
items.summary: Goldman Sachs has secured significant gains, ranging from 50% to 155%, from its India portfolio companies over the past year. This impressive performance occurred despite Indian equities posting muted returns and facing FII selling. The global investment giant successfully identified high-performing stocks amidst market turbulence.

items.title: Runwal Realty plans Rs 2,000-crore IPO
items.summary: Runwal Realty has filed for an IPO to raise up to ₹2,000 crore, including a fresh issue of ₹1,700 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹300 crore. The Mumbai-based developer intends to utilize the net proceeds primarily for debt repayment and general corporate purposes, supporting its extensive project portfolio and future expansion plans across various segments.

items.title: Tech leads Asia share rally, gold near record high on Fed rate cut bets
items.summary: Asian tech shares rallied Thursday. Gold reached a new record high. The dollar lost ground. A weak US labor report bolstered bets for Federal Reserve rate cuts. This market sentiment lifted indexes despite a US government shutdown. Oil prices also gained. Traders expect easier policy ahead, influencing global finance.

items.title: Oil rebounds from 16-week lows on prospects of tighter Russian crude sanctions
items.summary: Oil prices rose on Thursday, ending a three-day decline. Russian sanctions prospects supported the increase. OPEC+ supply next month capped gains. G7 nations plan pressure on Russia. The US will aid Ukraine with intelligence for strikes. A US government shutdown raised economic concerns. OPEC+ may boost output. US crude inventories increased last week.

items.title: FPIs continue selling equities in September, but at a slower pace
items.summary: Foreign portfolio investors continued as net sellers in Indian equities for September 2025, marking six out of nine months of outflows this year. A significant concern is their reduced primary market investment, totaling $5 billion despite heightened IPO activity. This contrasts sharply with last year's net purchases, though domestic funds provided strong support.

items.title: WeWork India Management raises  Rs1,348.26 crore from 67 anchor investors
items.summary: WeWork India Management raised Rs 1,348.26 crores from 67 anchor investors at the upper end of its IPO price band. The company allotted over 2 crore equity shares to a diverse group of domestic and global institutional investors, including mutual funds and sovereign wealth funds.

items.title: Piyush Goyal lauds TEPA coming into force; says India engaging with world from position of strength
items.summary: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced the India-EFTA Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement (TEPA) has come into force, marking a significant milestone in India's engagement with developed nations. This landmark deal, featuring a robust IP chapter, targets USD 100 billion investment and one million jobs, reflecting India's growing global confidence and strength.

items.title: Stock Market Holiday: Are BSE, NSE open or closed today for Dussehra and Gandhi Jayanti?
items.summary: Indian stock exchanges will remain shut on October 2 for Dussehra and Gandhi Jayanti, offering traders a break after recent volatility. The market has four more holidays this year, including a special afternoon Muhurat Trading session on October 21. Following a strong rebound, analysts anticipate sustained positive momentum for equities.

items.title: Elon Musk creates history! Tesla boss becomes first person ever to hit net worth of $500 billion
items.summary: As of 7:17 IST, Elon Musk's net worth stood at $499.1 billion, the Forbes list showed. As per Bloomberg Billionaires Index, the net worth of Elon Musk at the time of writing this article was $470 billion.

items.title: Stock market holiday: BSE, NSE to remain closed today for Dussehra, Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti
items.summary: Stock market holiday: As per the BSE stock market holiday calendar, the next market holiday in 2025 are on October 21 for Diwali and Laxmi Pujan, followed by October 22 for Diwali and Balipratipada.

items.title: Gold rallies to record high on US government shutdown and Fed rate cut bets
items.summary: Gold prices surged to a record high Wednesday, propelled by a weaker dollar due to a U.S. government shutdown and softer jobs data. This reinforced expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut this month, boosting gold's safe-haven appeal. Increased investor appetite suggests potential further gains, possibly exceeding $4,000/oz.

items.title: Mint Quick Edit | Can Trump end the Gaza war? His bold plan faces stiff obstacles
items.summary: Trump’s latest Gaza plan promises an end to war and keeps alive the prospect of a two-state solution, but its success hinges on Hamas’s surrender, Israel’s internal politics and the credibility of the US as a peace guarantor. Deal-making doesn’t get harder than this.

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks closed today on October 2 for Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra and Vijaya Dashami?
items.summary: Bank holiday today, 2 October: There is a bank holiday today at all banks in India, including SBI (State Bank of India), ICICI Bank, HDFC Bank, Punjab National Bank and others for Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra and Vijaya Dashami

items.title: Global Markets Today: Kospi jumps 2%, Nikkei 225 rises 1% - here's why
items.summary: Global Markets Today: South Korea’s Kospi index surged more than 2 per cent on Thursday, driven by strong gains in Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix

items.title: Donald Trump's Pfizer deal could change how governments tackle medicine prices
items.summary: Pfizer's agreement with the Trump administration raises critical questions about market freedom and regulatory overreach.

items.title: September GST collection rises 9%, defies slowdown expectations
items.summary: India's GST collections hit Rs 1.89 lakh crore in September, a 9.1% year-on-year increase, defying expectations of a consumption slowdown. This robust growth, reflecting August transactions, indicates a resilient domestic economy and strong discretionary demand. Experts anticipate continued positive collection trends, buoyed by the upcoming festive season, despite future rate rationalization.

items.title: Kotak PE arm plans $2 bn fund amid rising private credit demand
items.summary: The asset manager is in talks with global investors, including sovereign wealth funds and pension funds, in line with its previous strategies.

items.title: Tata Motors speeds past Hyundai, M&M to 2nd spot in PV race, extends lead over JSW MG in EV registrations
items.summary: Tata Motors secured the second spot in India's passenger vehicle market in September. The company surpassed Hyundai and Mahindra in registrations. This rise came from SUV and electric vehicle sales. Tata Motors also widened its lead over JSW MG Motor in the EV segment. Maruti Suzuki maintained its market dominance. Overall EV registrations increased during the month.

items.title: No rate cut, but RBI trims rules, drops overlapping biz regulations in credit push
items.summary: The RBI kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and raised FY26 GDP growth to 6.8%, while flagging tariff-related headwinds and unveiling measures to boost banking and credit flow.

items.title: RBI rings in banking changes, leaves key rate unchanged
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India relaxed several rules on Wednesday. This aimed to boost credit and economic growth. Individuals can now borrow more for stock investments. Companies can use bank funding for takeovers. Businesses gained access to loans from abroad. The RBI governor raised the GDP outlook. He lowered the inflation projection for FY26.

items.title: India’s oil market splits as state refiners cut Russian crude & private players ramp up buys
items.summary: India's oil market is split, with state-run refiners significantly cutting Russian crude imports in September due to US pressure and narrowing discounts, prioritizing supply security. Conversely, private refiners increased sourcing, driven by profit and economical options. This divergence led to an overall decrease in Russian oil imports to India.

items.title: Billion-$ play: IHC to acquire controlling stake of 40-45% in Sammaan Capital
items.summary: Abu Dhabi-based International Holding Co. (IHC) is set to acquire a 40–45% controlling stake in Sammaan Capital Ltd, formerly Indiabulls Housing Finance, for about $1 billion, according to people aware of the deal. The UAE conglomerate, backed by Sheikh Tahnoon bin Zayed Al Nahyan, is expected to make an open offer for an additional 26%, which could raise its ownership beyond 65%.

items.title: Musk becomes first person to hit $500 billion net worth, Forbes list shows
items.summary: Tesla stock has been driving the increase in Mr. Musk's net worth; the shares have risen more than 14% so far this year

items.title: RBI to ease norms for banks’ corporate exposure via market securities, to repeal earlier framework
items.summary: RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra said that the central bank is not worried about a resurgence in concentration risk given the introduction of other frameworks monitoring corporate exposure since then, and given the significant reduction in corporate credit exposure of banks over this period.

items.title: FIU-IND issues notices to 25 offshore crypto exchanges
items.summary: India's Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU-IND) has issued notices to 25 offshore cryptocurrency exchanges, including Huione and Paxful, for violating anti-money laundering laws. These platforms were serving Indian users without mandatory registration, prompting FIU-IND to order the takedown of their apps and URLs.

items.title: MercadoLibre Slumps as Rival Amazon Boosts Presence in Brazil
items.summary: Shares of MercadoLibre Inc. are heading for their biggest two-day slump since November on concern that Amazon.com Inc.’s latest move in Brazil will ramp up competition in the e-commerce segment.

items.title: Tracking of pledged $100 billion investments by EFTA in works, says Swiss minister
items.summary: India and the EFTA bloc have activated their TEPA, establishing a monitoring mechanism for EFTA's $100 billion investment commitment over 15 years. This significant pact, contingent on India's GDP growth, allows New Delhi to partially withdraw tariff concessions if investment targets are not met, strengthening the rule of law.

items.title: Factory activity slows to 4-month low in September
items.summary: India’s manufacturing PMI slipped to a four-month low of 57.7 in September, with slower growth in new orders, output, and hiring, according to an HSBC-S&P Global survey. Despite robust input cost inflation, business confidence hit a seven-month high, driven by GST cuts and stronger export demand offsetting US tariff pressures.

items.title: Cabinet raises wheat MSP by 6.6% ahead of rabi sowing, clears major pulses push
items.summary: The Centre raised wheat MSP by 6.6% to ₹2,585/quintal for 2026-27, ahead of rabi sowing, and set a production target of 119 mt. It also approved a ₹11,400 crore six-year mission to boost pulses output by expanding cultivation, distributing seed kits, and promoting high-yield, climate-resilient varieties.

items.title: Festive boost: Cabinet clears 3% DA, DR hike from July 1, 2025
items.summary: The Union cabinet approved a 3% increase in dearness allowance and dearness relief for 12 million central government employees and pensioners, effective July 1, 2025, aiming to spur consumption. Additionally, a ₹6,957 crore project for four-laning NH-715 in Assam was sanctioned, featuring an elevated corridor through Kaziranga National Park to protect wildlife.

items.title: Swiss chocolates and watches get cheaper as India-EFTA trade pact kicks in
items.summary: The trade agreement between India and the four-nation EFTA bloc has come into force, securing a $100 billion investment commitment for India over 15 years. India will phase out customs duties on products like Swiss watches and chocolates over a decade.

items.title: Andhra demand for fee waiver casts shadow on Adani solar deal
items.summary: Since April, Adani has sent many letters urging Andhra Pradesh to begin offtaking power under a 2021 deal, the sources said. The deal for 7,000 megawatts of solar power was signed between Andhra Pradesh, Adani Green and the Solar Energy Corporation of India, a government intermediary that is meant to ensure parties abide by their contractual obligations.

items.title: Forex rules relaxed to help export, import processing
items.summary: In another relief, RBI has simplified the closure of small-value transactions. The earlier relaxation for exporters under the Export Data Processing and Management System (EDPMS) has now been extended to importers through the Import Data Processing and Management System (IDPMS).

items.title: US tariffs on India a wrong approach: Phil Murphy, New Jersey Governor
items.summary: New Jersey has over 60 Indian life sciences companies including Biocon, BDR Pharma, Lupin, Meteoric Pharma, Dr Reddy's Labs, Rubicon Research, Cipla, Aurobindo and Enzene Biosciences. Also, New Jersey has the highest concentration of Indian-Americans in the US, making it an ideal landing spot for Indian businesses.

items.title: Reliance set to launch Campa Sure water with regional partners
items.summary: Reliance Consumer Products is launching Campa Sure, a new mass-priced packaged water brand, aiming to disrupt the ₹30,000-crore market. It will partner with regional bottlers and offer prices 20-30% lower than competitors. This aggressive strategy seeks to democratize the category and curb counterfeits, starting with Northern markets.

items.title: Overseas borrowing may soon get easier and cheaper for Indian companies
items.summary: "Based on the review, a revised framework that provides for expansion of eligible borrower and recognised lender base, rationalisation of borrowing limits, rationalisation of restrictions on average maturity period, removal of restrictions on the cost of borrowing for ECBs, review of end-use restrictions and simplification of reporting requirements, is proposed to be introduced," said Sanjay Malhotra, governor, RBI.

items.title: Pricing depends on the country, Bayer looks at affordability: Executive
items.summary: India has evolved significantly in the clinical trial setting...we have a significant number of patients and trials running in IndiaAshraf Al-Ouf Head, Pharmaceutical Commercial Ops, APAC, Bayer

items.title: Rupee pushed to the front in cross border transactions
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) proposed measures to promote wider use of the rupee in cross-border trade, particularly with neighboring countries Nepal, Bhutan, and Sri Lanka, and other major trading partners.

items.title: What changes does the BSBD account draft propose?
items.summary: The RBI proposed expanding services for basic savings bank deposit (BSBD) accounts, including digital banking, cheque books, and unlimited free digital transactions like UPI. This aims to promote cashless inclusion for low-income customers by March 2026. Additionally, the ombudsman scheme will be strengthened to cover rural cooperative banks for improved grievance redressal.

items.title: Delhi High Court orders Gensol to hand over remaining EVs to Smas Auto
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has directed Gensol Engineering's resolution professional to hand over remaining electric vehicles to Smas Auto Leasing India and facilitate ownership transfer. This order follows Gensol's failure to pay lease dues and comes amidst its promoters facing Sebi bans and Fema detention for alleged financial misconduct and fund diversion, including misuse of EV-related loans.

items.title: Petrol, diesel sales rev up on festive rush
items.summary: India's petrol and diesel sales saw significant increases in September, driven by the festival season and higher vehicle sales following GST reduction. Petrol climbed 7.5% and diesel rose 6.27% year-on-year. Conversely, jet fuel sales declined for the third consecutive month, while cooking gas demand also grew robustly.

items.title: Nayara Energy crude imports shrink, exports fall 60% amid sanctions
items.summary: Sanctions-hit Nayara Energy continued struggling in September, relying entirely on Russian crude for a second consecutive month. Its crude imports dropped 22% year-on-year, while fuel exports plunged nearly 60%, highlighting significant issues with compliance, shipping, and payment channels. Product stocks are likely high due to difficulties in moving barrels under sanctions-related constraints.

items.title: Indian Railways emerging as global exporter; equipment sent to over 16 countries, says ministry
items.summary: Indian Railways is expanding its global exports of railway equipment under the 'Make in India, Make for the World' initiative, supplying bogies, coaches, locomotives, and propulsion systems to over 16 countries.

items.title: ‘Misinformation, mischievous’: TCS rejects NITES claims about IT major ‘forcing’ 2,500 Pune employees to resign
items.summary: TCS faces accusations from NITES regarding its layoffs, which reportedly affect 2,500 employees in Pune. TCS maintains that the layoffs are part of a skill realignment initiative and denies the claims made by NITES.

items.title: TCS drags SpiceJet to court over unpaid tech bills of Rs 2.34 crore
items.summary: The Delhi HC has summoned SpiceJet in a recovery case filed by Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) for ₹2.34 crore. TCS seeks attachment of the airline's IGI Airport property, alleging SpiceJet refused to pay for software services provided since 2019 despite acknowledging dues. The court has given SpiceJet four weeks to respond, with the next hearing scheduled for November 14.

items.title: Sitharaman links pension reforms to the Atmanirbhar Bharat vision
items.summary: NPS reforms were aimed at addressing both the supply and demand sides of India’s pension framework, from the industry as well as the consumer perspective, says Nirmala Sitharaman.

items.title: Coal India production drops in September to 48.97 MT
items.summary: Coal India Limited reported a 3.9 percent production decline in September, reaching 48.97 million tonnes. This drop occurred despite government efforts to boost output. Many CIL subsidiaries saw reduced production. Experts cited heavy monsoon rains and waterlogging as reasons. Overall production for April-September decreased. CIL targets 875 million tonnes by 2025-26.

items.title: Power consumption grows 3.2% to 145.91 billion units in September
items.summary: India’s power consumption in September rose 3.21% to 145.91 billion units, supported by moderate temperatures due to widespread rainfall, which kept cooling demand low. Peak power demand reached 229.15 GW, well below the government’s projected 277 GW.

items.title: Hopeful to sign trade pact with EU soon: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said India hopes to soon sign a free trade agreement (FTA) with the European Union (EU) to boost trade and investment. Negotiations resumed in June 2022 after an eight-year gap and aim to conclude by December. The FTA covers 23 areas, including goods, services, investment, intellectual property, and sustainable development.

items.title: Who is Judson Althoff? Satya Nadella appoints new CEO to run Microsoft’s commercial business
items.summary: Judson Althoff will lead what Microsoft CEO Nadella called a new organisation, which will combine sales, marketing and operations

items.title: Roche Pharma commits 1.5 billion Swiss franc investment in India over next five years
items.summary: Swiss healthcare major Roche Pharma is committing 1.5 billion Swiss Francs to India over the next five years, focusing on core businesses and R&D. Announced at the India-EFTA Prosperity Summit, this investment highlights India's significance as a market and innovation hub. The company also plans to collaborate with schemes like Ayushman Bharat to broaden product access.

items.title: Hero MotoCorp sales up 8 pc to 6,87,220 units in September
items.summary: In the domestic market, the company dispatched 6,47,582 units last month, as compared with 6,16,706 units in the year-ago period, Hero MotoCorp said in a statement.

items.title: Would like to have a bilateral investment treaty with India: Swiss Minister
items.summary: Switzerland seeks a bilateral investment treaty with India. This follows a new trade pact with EFTA nations. The pact includes a 100 billion dollar investment commitment over 15 years. India is negotiating similar treaties with other countries. These agreements protect and promote investments. India aims to improve its investment regime. The country signed two such treaties in 2024.

items.title: MoS Telecom discusses call drop, network coverage issues with telcos, officials
items.summary: Union Minister Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar recently pulled up telecom operators and officials over persistent public grievances regarding call drops, network coverage, and mobile number portability. He urged service providers to ensure reliable network quality and smooth MNP, emphasizing the need for robust, consumer-friendly grievance redressal systems to enhance public service experience and strengthen telecom infrastructure.

items.title: Mexican Peso Bulls See Trade, Carry Sustaining Currency’s Rally
items.summary: Analysts from Barclays Plc to Citigroup Inc. are bullish on the Mexican peso in the short term, finding favor in the country’s positive trade relationship with the US and strong carry dynamics.

items.title: Cucinelli Confirms Growth Goal as It Rejects Short-Seller Claims
items.summary: Brunello Cucinelli SpA confirmed its target for full-year growth as sales jumped by 11% in the first nine months on continued demand for the company’s luxury cashmere products. The Italian fashion group rejected claims by a short seller that had led to the steepest drop on record in its shares.

items.title: Trump Plans Review of Equinor’s Empire Wind 2 Near New York
items.summary: The Trump administration told a federal court it intends to reconsider a key US government approval that authorized the construction of Equinor ASA’s planned second phase of an offshore wind project near New York and New Jersey.

items.title: RBI moves in to boost credit flow to commercial sectors of the economy
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India unveils major reforms. Banks will now fund corporate acquisitions. Risk weights ease for NBFCs, MSMEs, and home loans. This boosts credit flow across key sectors. RBI also scraps old guidelines on large borrower exposure. These changes aim for a more mature financial ecosystem. The new measures will enhance credit availability.

items.title: First Brands’ Fall Renews Concerns Over Murky Trade Finance
items.summary: When the auto-parts supplier First Brands Group filed for bankruptcy on Sunday, one name popped up in the documents again and again: Raistone.

items.title: MoS textiles & MEA in Moscow as India eyes Russian textile market
items.summary: Minister Pabrita Margherita travels to Moscow this week. India is seeking new markets for its textile exports. US tariffs impacted Indian textile exporters. Russia is a market for these goods. Margherita will meet Russian officials and inaugurate a textile fair. Over 100 Indian companies will participate. The fair aims to boost trade with Russia and CIS nations.

items.title: Would like to have a bilateral investment treaty with India: Swiss Minister
items.summary: Would like to have a bilateral investment treaty with India: Swiss Minister

items.title: Deutsche Bank Sued in UK by Bankers Blamed in Monte Paschi Scandal
items.summary: A group of former Deutsche Bank AG managers who claimed they were wrongfully blamed for the Monte dei Paschi accounting scandal have sued the German lender in a London court.

items.title: Macron says a tanker off France is linked to Russias shadow oil fleet
items.summary: Macron says a tanker off France is linked to Russia's shadow oil fleet

items.title: India-EFTA trade pact comes into force
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

items.title: Govt raises wheat MSP by 6.59% to Rs 2,585 per quintal for 2026-27
items.summary: The government announced a 6.59 per cent increase in the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for wheat to Rs 2,585 per quintal for the 2026-27 marketing year. MSPs for five other rabi crops were also hiked, aiming to ensure remunerative prices for farmers and incentivise crop diversification, aligning with the 1.5 times cost of production policy.

items.title: Andhra Pradesh's demand for transmission fee waiver troubles Adani solar deal
items.summary: Without waiver, cost could rise 40% to ₹3.49 per unit

items.title: Cal-Maine Plunges as Shoppers Switch to Fancier, Specialty Eggs
items.summary: Cal-Maine Foods Inc., the top US egg producer, is noticing a major trend in the market: consumers are shifting to fancier varieties that they consider to be more sustainable.

items.title: IRDAI alerts public to fraudulent consumer education website
items.summary: The general public is advised to refrain from accessing or engaging with the fraudulent website and to rely only on the IRDAI’s official portals, the regulator said

items.title: CCI orders probe into PVR INOX for alleged abuse of dominance over VPF fee
items.summary: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered a probe into multiplex chain PVR INOX for allegedly abusing its dominant position by continuing to charge virtual print fees (VPF) from producers after full digital conversion. The investigation follows a complaint by the Film and Television Producers' Guild, citing discrimination against smaller filmmakers.

items.title: Centre releases  ₹1.01 trillion as tax devolution to states ahead of Diwali — here's how much each state will get
items.summary: The Union government will release an additional  ₹1,01,603 crore to states on 1 October 2025 for capital spending and welfare ahead of the festive season.

items.title: European Prosecutors Probe Northern Data’s €500 Million GPU Buy
items.summary: A criminal investigation that led to raids of Northern Data AG’s offices last week is focused on whether the company illegally claimed a tax break on about €500 million ($586 million) worth of high-performance computing chips, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Railways: CBAT result for assistant loco pilot vacancies declared; over 18,000 clear test
items.summary: The Railway Recruitment Boards announced the final results for 18,735 assistant loco pilot hires on October 1, 2025. Selected candidates will undergo document verification, medical exams, and 120 days of training before joining.

items.title: Dutch Pension Giant Confirms 2026 Move, Boosting Steepener Bets
items.summary: Traders stepped up wagers on a steeper European interest-rate curve, after a major Dutch pension fund signaled that it’s on track to shift to a new system next year.

items.title: Blackstone’s McCarthy-Baldwin ‘Enthusiastic’ on Data Centers
items.summary: Blackstone Inc. is enthusiastic on data centers because of an explosion in demand for computing, and it doesn’t see a bubble in the sector, according to Kathleen McCarthy-Baldwin, the alternative asset manager’s global co-head of real estate.

items.title: RBI measures to improve credit flow, strengthen balance sheet of banks: Bankers
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India unveiled measures to expand credit flow, strengthen bank balance sheets, and enhance ease of doing business, receiving widespread approval from bankers. While key interest rates remained unchanged to assess previous policy impacts, these steps are seen as growth-accretive and supportive of India's resilient economic fundamentals amidst global uncertainties.

items.title: RBI's Digital Payments Intelligence Platform to flag risky transactions
items.summary: The RBI is developing a Digital Payments Intelligence Platform (DPIP) using AI to detect risky transactions and prevent fraud. The system will analyze data from multiple sources to issue pre-transaction alerts, helping banks and customers decide whether to proceed. DPIP aims to enhance real-time fraud risk management, addressing digital frauds, which totaled Rs 520 crore across 13,516 cases in FY25.

items.title: US markets regulators start shuttering as government shutdown cuts federal funding
items.summary: U.S. market regulators began the process of furloughing workers on Wednesday as the federal government shut down after Congress failed to extend funding, curtailing key oversight functions, stymieing initial public offerings, and limiting some market and economic data.

items.title: TCS allegedly forced around 2,500 employees in Pune to resign: NITES
items.summary: TCS allegedly forced around 2,500 employees in Pune to resign: NITES

items.title: Lupin launches generic of Janssen Pharma’s VTE drug in U.S.
items.summary: Rivaroxaban for Oral Suspension is indicated for treatment of venous thromboembolism (VTE) and reduction in the risk of recurrent VTE in paediatric patients

items.title: Central Asia's maiden crypto fund launched in Kazakhstan
items.summary: Kazakhstan has launched Alem Crypto Fund, its first crypto fund, managed by Qazaqstan Venture Group within AIFC. Backed by Binance Kazakhstan, it targets long-term digital asset investments, strategic reserves, and state-level savings for advancing digital finance.

items.title: Infra.Market files IPO papers via confidential route; seeks to raise up to Rs 5,500-cr
items.summary: Tiger Global-backed construction material supply firm Infra.Market has filed for an initial public offering (IPO) worth between Rs 4,500 crore and Rs 5,500 crore with market regulator Sebi using the confidential pre-filing route, market sources said on Wednesday.

items.title: Nubank Sees Chance to Lure More Than Just Expats in US Expansion
items.summary: Nu Holdings Ltd., Latin America’s most valuable financial firm, sees an opportunity to reach beyond just customers from that region with its planned US expansion.

items.title: Realtor Runwal Developers approaches Sebi to mobilise Rs 2,000 cr via IPO
items.summary: Real estate company Runwal Developers has submitted its draft papers with markets regulator Sebi for raising Rs 2,000 crore through its initial public offering (IPO).

items.title: Netflix shares extend slide to third day, drop 3% to 2-week low. Here's why
items.summary: Netflix's stock fell 3% to a two-week low of $1,163.21, influenced by Elon Musk's calls for a boycott. The decline is compounded by market negativity due to a U.S. government shutdown and concerns over potential tariffs on foreign films imposed by Trump.

items.title: IPO optimally priced to ensure long-term shareholder valuation: LG Electronics India
items.summary: After setting the price band for its massive Rs 11,607 crore IPO at Rs 1,080-1,140 per share on Wednesday, LG Electronics India said the initial offering was "optimally priced" to ensure long-term shareholder valuation.

items.title: US Pfizer deal powers European health stocks as Trump policy haze clears
items.summary: European healthcare stocks jumped on Wednesday, mirroring moves in the United States, propelled by a deal between Pfizer and President Donald Trump to lower prescription drug prices in the Medicaid programme in exchange for tariff relief.

items.title: IndiGo announces new domestic route connecting Coimbatore and Ahmedabad
items.summary: IndiGo will launch direct flights between Coimbatore and Ahmedabad from October 26, operating four times a week with Airbus A320 aircraft. The service, the only direct connection between the two cities, aims to improve travel convenience and strengthen trade and tourism links. Flights will operate on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays in both directions.

items.title: IPO pipeline heats up: CJ Darcl Logistics, Lalbaba Engineering, Pride Hotels and Jerai Fitness file DRHP with Sebi
items.summary: India’s primary market is poised for growth with four IPOs—CJ Darcl Logistics, Lalbaba Engineering, Pride Hotels, and Jerai Fitness—filing DRHPs with Sebi. Offers include fresh issues and OFS, spanning logistics, engineering, hospitality, and fitness sectors.

items.title: Commodity Radar: Oil seen weak in October. Anand Rathi expert recommends Sell amid double trouble
items.summary: Oil prices fell for the third consecutive day as OPEC+ considers raising production by 500,000 bpd in November. WTI traded near $62, Brent at $65.79, pressured by global supply surplus concerns despite strong demand and geopolitical risks.

items.title: 25 offshore crypto exchanges face govt action, including Huione, CEX.IO, BingX
items.summary: India's financial intelligence unit initiated a significant crackdown, issuing notices to 25 offshore cryptocurrency platforms, including major players like Huobi and Paxful. These firms operated illegally without PMLA registration, mandated since March 2023. FIU-IND ordered blocking their Indian access, emphasizing an ongoing push to formalize crypto.

items.title: NMDC’s September iron ore output rises 23%, sales 10%
items.summary: In the first half of FY26, the State-owned miner and India’s largest iron ore producer clocked more than 27% increase in output, 12% higher sales

items.title: Indian households see moderation in price pressures over a year
items.summary: RBI’s latest round of household inflation expectations survey shows that inflation expectations for the next three months and one year ahead declined by 20 bps and 30 bps

items.title: ET Market Watch: Sensex surges over 700 points on RBI policy boost
Jinkushal Industries IPO to list on Friday; GMP indicates strong listing. Check price and other key details here
items.summary: Jinkushal Industries, a construction machinery exporter, is set to debut on October 3 following strong response from investors. With a grey market premium of  ₹21, the estimated listing price stood at  ₹142 per share, reflecting a 17.32% increase from the issue price.

items.title: Wall Street edges down as paltry jobs data & govt shutdown stoke uncertainty, Nike jumps 4%
items.summary: At 10:08 AM ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.14%, the S&amp;P 500 lost 0.32%, the Nasdaq Composite shed 0.41%

items.title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India’s free trade agreement with the four-nation European bloc EFTA has come into force, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said, calling it a “historic day.” The India-EFTA Trade and Economic Partnership Agreement (TEPA) aims to boost trade, investment, and job creation.

items.title: RBI mulls further measures to internationalise the Rupee
items.summary: The aforementioned move is aimed at promoting the settlement of cross border transactions in Indian Rupee (INR) and local currencies as part of RBI’s overall efforts to internationalise the domestic currency

items.title: Car sales bounce back in September after four-month slump on new tax rates
items.summary: Indian car sales rose in September after four months of decline. New tax rates and festive demand increased customer purchases. Automakers stepped up dispatches to meet this demand. Maruti Suzuki reported retail growth despite wholesale adjustments. Tata Motors and Mahindra recorded sales increases. Two-wheeler and commercial vehicle segments showed demand. Farm equipment sales also grew.

items.title: Boardroom barometer: India's top firms tick boxes, but lag on diversity and independence
items.summary: Despite an increase in board meetings, corporate India's top 100 listed companies still face major governance gaps, according to a survey by Excellence Enablers.

items.title: Cabinet okays widening of Kaliabor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 to 4-lane highway
items.summary: Project to be developed on engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) mode with total length of 85.675 km and total capital cost of ₹6,957 crore

items.title: Rs 2000 notes worth Rs 5,884 crore still in circulation: RBI
items.summary: Rs 2000 notes worth Rs 5,884 crore remain in circulation. The Reserve Bank of India announced their withdrawal in May 2023. Most notes, 98.35 percent, have returned. Exchange facilities are available at RBI offices. Individuals can also send notes via India Post for bank account credit. This process continues.

items.title: US stocks trade lower as government shutdown risks economic data delays
items.summary: US stock indexes declined Wednesday as soft private payrolls data intensified bets on a Federal Reserve rate cut. A looming federal government shutdown further heightened market uncertainty, risking delays in crucial economic reports like nonfarm payrolls. While healthcare stocks gained, communication services and tech sectors saw declines, reflecting investor caution amidst a fragile economic mood.

items.title: Direct & indirect tax cuts will improve savings rate in India: Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran
items.summary: CEA V. Anantha Nageswaran said tax cuts and GST 2.0 reforms will improve savings and boost domestic demand. Speaking at the Reforms Reloaded 2025 summit, he noted earlier growth reduction estimates of 0.4-0.5% may be lower due to reforms. He projected FY26 GDP growth at the upper end of 6.3–6.8%, supported by tax concessions and employment generation.

items.title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
items.summary: The Union Commerce Minister said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

items.title: Kia India sales dip 3% to 22,700 units in September
items.summary: Kia India reported a 3% drop in September sales to 22,700 units from 23,523 last year. The company said recent GST reforms and the festive season have improved customer sentiment, boosting demand across its product range.

items.title: Cabinet nod for Biomedical Research Career Programme Phase-III
items.summary: Government approved Biomedical Research Career Programme Phase III. This program will train over 2,000 students and fellows. It aims to generate significant research and commercialize technologies. The initiative costs Rs 1,500 crore over six years from 2025-26. It will strengthen research systems and reduce regional disparities. This creates strong biomedical research capacity.

items.title: Nike’s comeback takes shape with turnaround plans working
items.summary: Nike says efforts to roll out new products, boost marketing efforts and clear out old inventory helped blunt a longtime sales slump

items.title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to launch nationwide awareness campaign for unclaimed financial assets on October 4
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will launch a three-month nationwide awareness campaign, 'Apki Poonji, Apka Adhikar', starting October 2025. This initiative, involving key financial regulators, aims to empower citizens by providing guidance and tools to trace and claim their unclaimed financial assets. The campaign seeks to strengthen financial inclusion and ensure rightful claims for all.

items.title: Nasdaq and S&P 500 end mixed, gold hits record as US government shuts down
items.summary: S&P 500 futures and Nasdaq futures dropped about 0.5% each on Wednesday. Gold prices climbed to $3,895 an ounce, hitting a record high for a third straight session

items.title: India-EFTA trade deal couldn't have come at better time, it will be like a booster: Swiss State Secretary
items.summary: The deal is expected to cut tariffs on 92.2% of Indian product categories

items.title: UPI transactions to be charged? Here's what RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra says
items.summary: Governor Malhotra has also disclosed that the central bank is currently examining a proposal that would permit lenders to remotely disable or 'lock' mobile phones bought on credit in the event of a default on EMI payments.

items.title: D2C brands expanding offline presence, leases 6 lakh sq ft space in H1 2025: CBRE
items.summary: Direct-to-consumer brands will lease 5.95 lakh sq ft retail space in 2025. This will account for 18 percent of total leasing. Fashion and apparel will lead this expansion with 60 percent share. Brands are increasing their physical presence. This strategy aims to improve customer connection. Offline stores create a shopping environment.

items.title: Winter crops’ MSPs hiked 4-10%, self sufficiency mission on pulses approved
GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
items.summary: GST 2.0 reforms in the form of rate rationalisation, which came into force on September 22, have been reflected in the collections

items.title: States front-load borrowing in H1FY26, raise  ₹5 trillion
items.summary: Infrastructure push and global headwinds have driven record monthly state loans, with September alone hitting  ₹1.21 trillion.

items.title: Financial stability foremost priority, but we shouldn't impede growth through regulations: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said financial stability remains the central bank’s top priority, even as it eases compliance and business norms to support growth. Announcing calibrated relaxations, including higher limits on loans against shares, IPO financing, and cooperative bank licensing, he stressed regulations must balance prudence with ease of doing business.

items.title: Tesla stock is falling. Its cars just got more expensive.
items.summary: The monthly lease prices displayed on Tesla’s website are now higher, now that the federal $7,500 EV purchase tax credit has gone away.

items.title: Shankar Sharma says India, US at lowest exposure in 30 years, remains bearish on indices
items.summary: Ace investor Shankar Sharma reports his lowest India and US equity exposure in 30 years, citing strong global and China performance. Despite successes, the US remains a narrow, challenging market with underperformance versus benchmarks.

items.title: Euro zone yields little changed after US shutdown, eye Treasuries for direction
items.summary: Euro zone government bond yields were little changed, with investors closely watching moves in U.S. Treasuries amid a U.S. government shutdown.

items.title: Food delivery giants ride the health wave to fatten margins
items.summary: In response to India's healthy eating trend, Zomato and Swiggy are enhancing their platforms with features like 'Healthy Mode' and a High Protein category. While these initiatives aim to increase order values, restaurants worry about higher costs and margins affecting profitability.

items.title: India bond yields drop as rate cuts back on table
items.summary: Indian government bond yields declined on Wednesday, as the central bank is expected to ease policy over the coming months, and after the governor said that yields have further room to come down.

items.title: Gold crosses  ₹1.20 lakh mark: Watch out for these 5 investment mistakes
items.summary: Gold prices have touched a new peak of  ₹1.20 lakh per 10 grams. As the steep price rise signals both opportunities and risks, investors must avoid common mistakes, balance gold and silver allocations, and focus on long-term disciplined investment strategies.

items.title: US government shutdown: What does it mean for the US stock market? EXPLAINED
items.summary: The United States government shut down early Wednesday morning, its first in seven years, halts non-essential services and disrupts key data releases, increasing market uncertainty. Prolonged political deadlock may accelerate international investors' reallocation away from US assets.

items.title: Nissan reports 9.3% Y0Y growth with consolidated sales of 10,500 units in September
items.summary: Nissan Motor India reported September 2025 sales of 10,500 units, up 9.3% YoY, with domestic sales at 1,652 units and exports at 8,872 units, including a record 1,120 units to South Asia. Sales were boosted by GST-driven price cuts on the New Magnite and a 10-year warranty. Nissan is expanding its dealership network, aiming for 250 outlets by FY 2026-27.

items.title: The rise of micro-drama content in India: A new era in entertainment
items.summary: In a digital era, micro-drama applications are gaining immense popularity across India, catering to the audience's love for rapid storytelling. With investors flocking to support this burgeoning entertainment sector, projections indicate the market could soar to a staggering two billion dollars in just five years.

items.title: Gainers & Losers: Sun TV, Tata Motors, Hyundai among 7 stocks that moved most on Wednesday
items.summary: Nifty and Sensex ended their eight-day losing streak led by private banks, auto, and IT stocks. Sun TV, Netweb, Tata Motors, Pfizer, and HUDCO surged, while Hyundai and Indian Bank slipped amid RBI’s neutral policy stance.

items.title: Why the world is suddenly awash with a wave of co-CEOs
items.summary: Comcast, Oracle, and more have named Co-CEOs. The structure has worked in the past, but some say it makes no sense.

items.title: Deep depression in the making may spark stormy conditions over Bay
items.summary: India Met Department has stopped short of calling out a cyclone over the turbulent Bay, for now

items.title: Centre, states collect gross GST receipts of  ₹1.89 trillion in September
items.summary: After refunds, net GST collections were  ₹1.6 trillion, up 5%. The growth reflects resilience in India's domestic economy despite anticipated sales slowdowns ahead of GST rate changes.

items.title: The Oberoi Group unveils ASMI by Oberoi
items.summary: The Oberoi Group has launched ASMI by Oberoi, a new wellness offering rooted in the Indian philosophy of Pancha Kosha. This lifestyle framework focuses on five pillars: movement, nutrition, bodywork, breath work, and mindfulness, aiming for personal alignment and vitality. It will be introduced across the chain's portfolio in India, with international expansion planned for 2026.

items.title: RBI rolls out measures to boost rupee’s role in cross-border trade
items.summary: Steps include lending in rupees to neighbours, expanding SRVA investment options, and adding reference rates for partner currencies.

items.title: BSE NSE Holiday: Is the stock market shut or open on October 2 for Gandhi Jayanti, Dussehra?
items.summary: Indian equity markets will remain closed on October 2 for Dussehra and Gandhi Jayanti. October sees three additional trading holidays, including Diwali, with a special Muhurat session on October 21 for festive trading.

items.title: RBI plans to relax external commercial borrowing norms for India Inc
items.summary: In the works is a revised ECB framework that provides for expansion of eligible borrower and recognized lender base, rationalization of borrowing limits, and rationalization of restrictions on average maturity period

items.title: RBI’s pause: When monetary flexibility meets growth uncertainty
items.summary: With inflation easing, RBI has room to cut rates. But further rate cuts are contingent on how key risks to India's economic growth, including the US's steep tariffs, play out.

items.title: Zee marks 33 years of satellite broadcasting as India’s M&E industry hits ₹2.5 trillion
items.summary: India's media and entertainment industry, a ₹2.5 trillion powerhouse employing 2.8 million, celebrates 33 years since Zee TV's pioneering launch. The sector has expanded dramatically to over 900 TV channels and 70 OTT platforms, attracting significant foreign investment. It is projected to grow 7% annually to ₹3.07 trillion by 2027, reinforcing its role as a key soft power export.

items.title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
items.summary: The GST collections were 9.1% higher than the same month a year ago and over 1.5% higher than the previous month

items.title: India-EFTA trade deal couldn't have come at better time, it will be like a booster: Swiss State Secretary
items.summary: The free trade deal between India and the EFTA nations, comprising Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein, officially came into effect, promising transformative economic ties. Switzerland's State Secretary Helene Budliger highlighted the pact's significance, including a pledged USD 100 billion investment over 15 years and tariff reductions, emphasizing its long-negotiated nature rather than a response to current global trade disruptions.

items.title: As gold, silver soar, Gurmeet Chadha warns investors: ‘Don’t get carried away’. Here’s why
items.summary: Amid rising global uncertainty, gold and silver have surged to multi‑year highs, driven by geopolitical tensions, potential U.S. rate cuts, and a weakening rupee. Experts advise cautious exposure of 5–10% in portfolios, noting precious metals’ long, cyclical trends. While momentum remains, profit‑booking and corrections are possible.

items.title: Hurun India Rich List 2025: At 44, HCL's Roshni Nadar Malhotra becomes India’s richest woman, features among top 3
items.summary: Hurun India Rich List 2025: Roshni Nadar took over as the chairperson of HCL Technologies from her father in July 2020.

items.title: SC to hear Vodafone Idea's plea for quashing additional AGR demand on October 6
items.summary: The Supreme Court will hear Vodafone Idea's plea on October 6, challenging a fresh Rs 5,606 crore Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) demand from the DoT for 2016-17. This follows earlier apex court rulings that rejected reviews for AGR calculation rectification and stated no re-assessment of dues.

items.title: Maruti Suzuki sales up 3% at 1.89 lakh units in Sept
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki India reported a 3 percent rise in total sales for September, reaching 1,89,665 units. Domestic passenger vehicle dispatches decreased by 8 percent. Mini car sales fell 30 percent, while compact car sales increased. Utility vehicle sales declined 21 percent. Exports rose to 42,204 units. Logistical constraints impacted domestic figures.

items.title: Tata Investment, RBL Bank and 4 other stocks hit 52-week high; rally up to 55% in a month
items.summary: Tata Investment, RBL Bank and four other stocks from the BSE 500 index hit 52-week highs, driven by strong market momentum. The Sensex rose 716 points to 80,983, with Tata Investment gaining 55% in a month. Gains across these stocks reflect bullish investor sentiment amid broad market strength.

items.title: Who is Vis Raghavan? Indian- born banker emerges as key contender for Citi's CEO position
items.summary: Vis Raghavan, 58, oversees global banking operations and strategic initiatives of Citigroup, earning significant compensation, including a $52 million award.

items.title: US tariffs may stoke inflation and make rate cuts harder, says RBI
items.summary: Even as India’s economic outlook remains “resilient”, risks from evolving tariff actions, adverse weather events, and volatile global financial markets are expected to hamper growth and disinflation, the central bank said.

items.title: Ashok Leyland sales up 9% in September
items.summary: Commercial vehicle maker Ashok Leyland reported a 9 per cent rise in total sales, reaching 18,813 units in September compared to the previous year. Domestic sales also grew by 7 per cent to 17,209 units.

items.title: Tata Sons listing: RBI keeps its options open
items.summary: The RBI had mandated a public listing of Tata Sons by 30 September 2025, under its scale-based regulatory framework introduced in October 2022.

items.title: Kalyan Kumar takes over as MD and CEO of Central Bank of India
items.summary: Prior to his appointment, Mr. Kumar served as Executive Director of Punjab National Bank since October 2021

items.title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160/qtl to ₹2,585: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary: Government sets record wheat production target of 119 million tonne for 2025-26 crop year (July-June)

items.title: D-Street snaps 8-day losing streak as RBI policy fuels optimism; Tata Motors, Kotak lead gainers
items.summary: Sensex jumps 716 points, Nifty gains 225. Banking heavyweights Kotak, Axis, HDFC Bank and ICICI surge

items.title: Reserve Bank to link deposit insurance premiums to bank risk
items.summary: The central bank's shift from a decades-old flat-rate premium is designed to reward financially sound banks with lower costs and encourage prudent risk management across the sector; depositor protection of up to  ₹5 lakh remains fully intact.

items.title: US government shutdown threatens to disrupt IPO market momentum
items.summary: The U.S. government shut down much of its operations on Wednesday as deep partisan divisions prevented Congress and the White House from reaching a funding deal

items.title: Give emotional support to elderly; they are pillars of society: Director general of health services
items.summary: On International Day of Older Persons, experts underscored the urgent need for emotional and infrastructural support for India's rapidly growing elderly population. Discussions at Sitaram Bhartia Hospital highlighted preventive health measures like essential vaccinations, brain exercises, and nutritional care, addressing common age-related challenges and specific concerns for senior women.

items.title: Hurun India Rich List 2025: Mukesh Ambani tops chart but his wealth drops 6% — full list of top 10 richest
items.summary: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani topped the M3M Hurun India Rich List 2025.

items.title: Tata Capital IPO: 10 key risks you should know about before investing in  ₹15,512 crore issue
items.summary: Tata Capital's IPO opens for bidding on October 6, aiming to raise  ₹15,512 crore through a mix of fresh issues and an offer for sale. The price band is set at  ₹310– ₹326 per share, with shares listed on BSE and NSE on October 13.

items.title: Freight Tiger gets ₹120 crore additional investment from Tata Motors
items.summary: This latest infusion builds on Tata Motors’ earlier investment of ₹150 crore in October 2023, bringing the total investment to ₹270 crore

items.title: Sunburn Festival to launch first overseas edition in Abu Dhabi in 2026
items.summary: Sunburn Festival, India’s largest EDM brand, will stage its first full-scale international edition in Abu Dhabi in December 2026, marking its transition to a global platform. This strategic move aims to export Indian cultural IP and will run simultaneously with its long-standing Indian edition, expanding its global footprint.

items.title: Cabinet okays widening of Kaliabor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 to 4-lane highway
items.summary: The Cabinet approved widening the Kaliabor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 in Assam. This project costs Rs 6,957 crore and covers 85.675 km. It includes wildlife-friendly measures for Kaziranga National Park. The existing highway passes through the park. Heavy traffic causes frequent animal accidents. This development will improve connectivity and safety.

items.title: Royal Enfield posts highest-ever monthly sales in Sept, up 43%
items.summary: Royal Enfield reported its highest-ever monthly sales in September, reaching 1,24,328 units, a significant 43% increase year-on-year. Domestic sales surged by 43% to 1,13,573 units, while exports grew 41%. CEO B Govindarajan noted this strong performance marked an incredible start to the festive season, surpassing 100,000 retail volumes.

items.title: Alan Scott unveils AI-powered learning assistant KrishGuru
items.summary: We believe technology can stand as a humble partner — assisting teachers, supporting parents, and guiding children step by step, says Suresh Jain, Managing Director, Alan Scott Enterprises Ltd

items.title: Monetary policy rates aren’t all that determine an economy’s credit scenario
items.summary: RBI’s rate decisions serve primarily as signals, not guarantees. Markets may choose to follow or ignore them, influenced by a mix of various factors. It’s unwise to give these signals undue importance. Globally, monetary transmission is both slower and far-from-linear.

items.title: Nithin Kamath weighs in again on Zerodha strategy if weekly options scrapped
items.summary: Zerodha co-founder and CEO Nithin Kamath struck a calm note amid speculation that regulators may curb or even scrap weekly options trading — a move that could hit the brokerage’s revenues hard.

items.title: LG Electronics India IPO size at ₹11,628 crore, values it at $8.6 billion
items.summary: The company had obtained regulatory approval for the IPO in March but in April decided to call a halt to it, citing uncertain market conditions

items.title: ​How to calculate the sales to cash flow ratio
items.summary: ​The Sales to Cash Flow Ratio measures how efficiently a company converts sales into operating cash. Ratios near 1 indicate balance, above 1 shows strong cash generation, below 1 signals potential cash issues.

items.title: Tata Motors posts record 60,907 September sales, up 47% on GST cut and Navratri demand
items.summary: Tata Motors achieved its best-ever monthly passenger vehicle sales in September 2025, reaching 60,907 units, a 47% increase. This surge was fueled by GST rate cuts and festive demand, alongside record EV and CNG sales. The company anticipates sustained growth in H2 FY26, following a corporate demerger.

items.title: Rupee recovers 12 paise from all-time low to close at 88.68 against US dollar post RBI policy
items.summary: RBI announces a host of measures to support exporters and stabilise the rupee; leaves repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, maintains neutral stance

items.title: India raises wheat purchase price by 6.6% to boost output
items.summary: India has increased its new-season wheat purchase price by 6.6% to 2,585 rupees per 100 kg for 2026. This move aims to encourage farmers to expand acreage and boost supplies, as growers were shifting to more profitable rapeseed. The hike ensures continued interest in wheat cultivation for the world's second-biggest producer.

items.title: Goyal takes on overseas visits to push exports, charge up EU FTA talks
items.summary: With its US trade talks facing hurdles, a deal with the EU could signal India's ability to finalize ambitious trade pacts after recent successes with the United Arab Emirates and Australia.

items.title: CAMS board to meet on October 10 to consider stock split
items.summary: Computer Age Management Services (CAMS) has announced that its board of directors will meet on Friday, October 10, to consider a stock split aimed at altering the company’s share capital. The split ratio will be decided at the meeting.

items.title: DGTR starts countervailing duty probe into Chinese aluminium foil
items.summary: India's trade body has started a probe. It is investigating Chinese aluminium foil imports. The Directorate General of Trade Remedies will check for government subsidies. This investigation covers a period from April 2024 to March 2025. Domestic companies claim injury from these subsidised imports. This is not the first such trade action against Chinese foil.

items.title: Sun TV shares soar 18% as RCB’s potential sale seen leading to re-valuation of its IPL team Sunrisers Hyderabad
items.summary: Sun TV shares surged up to 18% as reports of a $2 billion valuation for RCB sparked optimism about higher valuations for Sunrisers Hyderabad, significantly boosting Sun TV’s balance sheet and market capitalisation outlook.

items.title: IPO season heats up in October with Tata Capital, LG Electronics India & WeWork
items.summary: October has brought renewed excitement to India’s primary markets as three major IPOs—Tata Capital, LG Electronics India, and WeWork India—gear up to launch in close succession.

items.title: Rupee logs best day in two weeks as dollar droops, RBI holds rates
items.summary: The Indian rupee recorded its best day in two weeks, gaining 0.1% against the dollar after the Reserve Bank of India kept policy rates unchanged. Likely central bank intervention limited further depreciation, while the dollar broadly slipped due to a U.S. government shutdown. The RBI also signaled potential rate cuts and unveiled measures to boost bank lending.

items.title: Ahead of IPO, LG India banks on domestic demand, premium portfolio and export hub ambition
items.summary: The IPO, scheduled for 7-9 October, will see the South Korean parent firm sell about 15% of its stake in its Indian arm. Since no new equity will be issued, the subsidiary will not receive any funds from the offering.

items.title: India central bank allows banks to fund acquisitions, lend more for IPOs
items.summary: INDIA-CENBANK-BANKS:India central bank allows banks to fund acquisitions, lend more for IPOs

items.title: 'Contaminated' cough syrup linked deaths: NCDS collects water, entomological drug samples
items.summary: NCDC collected water and entomological drug samples from Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan after multiple children died of kidney failure, allegedly linked to contaminated cough syrup. These samples will be tested for infectious diseases, while state drug authorities await results from drug sample tests. Six children died in MP and one in Rajasthan, prompting a ban on 19 syrup batches.

items.title: Cloud-powered feature phones could unlock 40% revenue growth for Indian telcos
items.summary: CloudMosa projects India's 350 million feature phone users can significantly boost telecom revenues. Their cloud-powered 4G devices, enabling smartphone features on affordable handsets, are expected to increase ARPU by 40% and reduce churn by 30%. This model, proven in Vietnam, offers scalable, affordable connectivity for India's 2G users.

items.title: Cabinet approves 57 new Kendriya Vidyalayas with an outlay of more than Rs 5,862 cr
items.summary: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs approved 57 new Kendriya Vidyalayas. These schools will cater to central government employees' children. The project involves Rs 5,862.55 crore over nine years from 2026-27. This includes capital and operational expenditures. For the first time, these KVs will feature Balvatikas. Twenty KVs will open in districts lacking existing schools.

items.title: US-based Sonos bets on India as premium audio demand rises despite global slowdown
items.summary: Sonos is intensifying its focus on India, identifying it as a rapidly growing market in Asia-Pacific despite a global revenue decline. The company is expanding its presence and localizing offerings, noting strong demand for premium, integrated audio systems among Indian consumers. Sonos aims to leverage its core strengths amidst competition in the evolving home audio segment.

items.title: Cash-Rich & Growing: 9 Midcap stocks with rising operating cash flow
items.summary: Ten NSE midcap companies, including Waaree Energies, Biocon, Sona BLW, UNO Minda, and Torrent Power, consistently grew operating cash flow over five years, signaling stronger profitability, efficient operations, and reduced reliance on external funding.

items.title: Top Gainers & Losers on Oct 01: Netweb Tech, Tata Motors, Adani Power, Vodafone Idea, Trent among top gainers
items.summary: The Indian stock market rebounded on October 1, with key indexes gaining nearly 1%. The rally, driven by banking stocks, followed RBI's measures to boost liquidity while maintaining the repo rate at 5.5%. Nifty Media surged 3.79%, while Nifty PSU Bank lagged with a 0.30% drop.

items.title: RBI announces host of measures to improve flow of Bank credit
items.summary: The aforementioned measures are being considered in a bid to rationalise the extant guidelines and broaden the scope for capital market lending by banks and other regulated entities

items.title: Stock market today: 118 stocks hit 52-week lows, 150 stocks at 52-week high as Nifty 50, Sensex end nearly 1% higher
items.summary: Stock market today: On Thursday, 150 stocks reached 52-week highs while 118 hit lows. The Sensex rose by 715.7 points and Nifty 50 by 0.92%, aided by the RBI maintaining the repo rate at 5.50%, signaling stable monetary policy and positive economic outlook.

items.title: GST 2.0, festive demand cheer car/ two-wheeler makers in September
items.summary: Maruti Suzuki India domestic despatches fall, but makes record retail sales in last 10 years

items.title: Sensex snaps 8-day losing streak, investors earn  ₹4 lakh crore in a day— 10 key highlights from Indian stock market
items.summary: Stock market today: The Sensex ended the day 716 points, or 0.89 per cent, higher at 80,983.31, while the Nifty 50 settled at 24,836.30, up 225 points, or 0.92 per cent.

items.title: This small-cap, agri stock jumps 80% YTD; do you own?
items.summary: GRM Overseas has experienced an impressive 80% rise in stock value this year, driven by strategic investments and a booming rice-export market. With major investors increasing their stakes and promising financial results, the company is well-positioned for future growth in the agri sector.

items.title: New online gaming law takes effect, money games banned from today
items.summary: India's new Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Act, 2025, has banned online money games nationwide, effective Wednesday. This move aims to curb social and financial risks, including money laundering and terror financing. The industry is now pivoting towards eSports and social gaming, with the government envisioning India as a global game development hub.

items.title: RBI drops proposed restriction on bank-NBFC overlap
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India scrapped plans to bar banks from overlapping business lines with their NBFC subsidiaries, offering a boost to private lenders. HDFC, ICICI, and Axis Bank shares rose as the move preserves flexibility for growth and customer targeting.

items.title: Trualt Bioenergy IPO listing date in focus: Here’s what GMP signals about debut of shares
items.summary: Trualt Bioenergy IPO listing date is 3 October 2025, and the stock will be listed on both the stock exchanges. Ahead of the share debut, Trualt Bioenergy IPO GMP today signals strong debut of shares in the stock market.

items.title: Most pilot training schools fail to make the grade in DGCA rankings
items.summary: India's civil aviation regulator, DGCA, ranked pilot training schools for the first time, revealing 63% need significant improvement as none achieved top ratings. Officials criticized DGCA's ranking role, citing potential bias and administrative hurdles faced by schools. This initiative aims to boost transparency and ensure a pipeline of quality trained pilots.

items.title: Gold rate today: How US government shut down likely to affect bullion? Experts weigh in
items.summary: Rahul Kalantri VP commodities at Mehta Equities Ltd, said that gold is often considered a safe-haven asset during political, economic, or financial stress, investors tend to shift capital into gold, which doesn’t carry credit risk in the same way that bonds or equities do.

items.title: RBI holds rates, signals policy space; fixed income managers see scope for December rate cut
items.summary: RBI’s Monetary Policy Committee kept repo rate unchanged at 5.5% with a dovish stance, lowering inflation forecasts, upgrading growth outlook, and unveiling 22 reforms. Experts expect a rate cut by December 2025, boosting bond market sentiment.

items.title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
items.summary: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

items.title: One year of ‘one Air India Express’: From branding to route mix changes, the airline tackles a plethora of challenges
items.summary: The merged entity, which is now over four times its size at the time of privatisation, has grown through every possible means — merger, induction of new aircraft, and transfer of planes from the parent Air India. However, Air India Express faces numerous challenges ahead.

items.title: Augmont Enterprises files DRHP with Sebi to raise Rs 800 crore via IPO
items.summary: Augmont Enterprises, an integrated gold and silver platform, has filed its DRHP with Sebi for an Rs 800 crore IPO, comprising Rs 620 crore fresh issue and Rs 180 crore OFS by promoters.

items.title: Cabinet approves Rs 11,000 cr six-year plan to boost pulses production, raises MSPs for Rabi crops
items.summary: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, approved a six-year, Rs 11,000 crore plan to boost domestic pulse production. The initiative aims to increase output, reduce import dependence, and strengthen food security. In a related move, the Cabinet also approved a proposal to raise the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for Rabi crops.

items.title: US government shutdown 2025: What it means for US and Indian stock market?
items.summary: As the US government enters its latest shutdown, experts assess its impact on the stock markets. While some fluctuations are expected, analysts believe the long-term effects will be minimal, with potential benefits for emerging markets like India amidst a weaker US dollar.

items.title: Pause gives banks breathing space, rate cut likely in December: SBI MD
items.summary: SBI MD Vinay Tonse welcomed the RBI's policy pause, offering banks breathing space after rate transmission. He anticipates a potential rate cut in December, with the terminal repo rate settling at 5.25%. Tonse also noted early busy season demand and expressed optimism for sustained credit growth and margin stability, benefiting SBI.

items.title: Trump’s drug tariff has spared most of China’s drugmakers for now but there may be worse to come
items.summary: Chinese drugmakers have been generic drug sellers but have lately begun reshaping global medicine with breakthrough therapies and lucrative deals. Could Trump’s trade policy, under which patented or branded drug imports face a 100% tariff, be aimed at stalling the rise of Chinese pharma rivals?

items.title: ATF price hiked 3%, commercial LPG up  ₹15.50
items.summary: ATF prices were hiked by over 3% or by  ₹3,053 and commercial LPG rates by  ₹15.50 per cylinder on October 1, as OMCs revised fuel prices in line with global benchmarks. Check how much fuel costs in Delhi from today.&nbsp;

items.title: Tata Sons missing IPO deadline: RBI says an entity can continue to do biz till registration isnt cancelled
items.summary: Tata Sons missing IPO deadline: RBI says an entity can continue to do biz till registration isn't cancelled

items.title: DA hike for govt employees: Cabinet okays 3% Dearness Allowance rate increase ahead of Diwali
items.summary: DA Hike: The Union Cabinet approved a 3% Dearness Allowance hike, raising it to 58% for central government employees and pensioners. This significant move, aimed at combating inflation, will benefit millions and is expected to be effective from July 1, 2025, with arrears. It follows a previous 2% increase earlier in March.

items.title: Despite missing listing deadline, Tata Sons to continue doing business: RBI Guv
items.summary: “We don’t comment on any specific entities. Any entity which has a registration, till it is not cancelled, will continue to do its business,” says RBI Governor Malhotra

items.title: RBI to remove ₹10,000 crore ceiling for bank loans to corporates
items.summary: Currently, each corporate entity is allowed to take up to ₹10,000 crore of loan from the entire Indian banking sector and if lenders surpass the ceiling, they have to make heavy provisions

items.title: Tata Motors shares rally 5% as demerger takes effect; record date announced
items.summary: Tata Motors shares rose sharply after the company’s demerger took effect from October 1, with October 14 set as the record date for shareholders. The restructuring, involving TML Commercial Vehicles and passenger vehicles, aims at a sharper business focus and unlocking long-term value.

items.title: RBI to issue draft ECL guidelines for banks soon
items.summary: The draft directions propose to replace the current framework based on incurred loss with an Expected Credit Loss (ECL) approach, subject to a prudential floor, while retaining the existing asset classification norms

items.title: Loan sanctions grow 86% to Rs 33,148 cr in H1; disbursement up 54%: IREDA
items.summary: State-owned IREDA sanctioned Rs 33,148 crore in loans during April-September FY26. This marks an 86 percent increase from the previous year. Loan disbursements also grew by 54 percent to Rs 15,043 crore. The outstanding loan book reached Rs 84,445 crore by September 30, 2025. CMD Pradip Kumar Das stated IREDA will continue supporting clean energy projects.

items.title: Nikhil Kamath hiring engineers to work with him on ‘High stakes. Real impact’ project — check if you fit the bill
items.summary: Nikhil Kamath is hiring engineers to work directly with him on a ‘High stakes. Real impact’ project for WTF podcast. In a detailed post on X, he wrote about what the ideal candidates would be — Interested? Check if you are a good fit.

items.title: Stock market holiday: Is Indian stock market closed tomorrow for Dussehra, Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti?
items.summary: Stock market holiday: Investors are advised to look at the stock market holidays 2025 list on the official BSE website — bseindia.com. Investors can click on the Trading Holidays toolbar at the top of the website to find out the list of stock market holidays in 2025.

items.title: Manufacturing PMI dips in September, while exports rise. Are both blips?
items.summary: The drop in the headline index may be a one-off as manufacturers are confident that GST cuts will boost domestic demand. And while demand from other countries may be offsetting a drop in demand from the US, it's too early to celebrate the increase in exports.

items.title: India Set to Open $40 Billion M&A Market to Local Bank Funding
items.summary: India’s central bank plans to permit local lenders to finance mergers and acquisitions, a move expected to boost the country’s $40 billion-plus deals market.

items.title: GST collection for September rises 9.1% to Rs 1.89 lakh crore
items.summary: India's GST collections surged to Rs 1.89 lakh crore in September, marking a 9.1% annual increase. Concurrently, the GST Council rationalized the tax structure, reducing four slabs to two (5% and 18%) by scrapping the 12% and 28% rates. This landmark reform, effective September 22, 2025, aims to boost consumption and ease household budgets.

items.title: RBI proposes higher lending limits against shares for IPOs
items.summary: The RBI has raised the ceiling for bank lending against shares to ₹1 crore and IPO financing limits to ₹25 lakh per individual. This relaxation, the first since 1998, aims to ease credit flows to capital markets. It comes amid rising demand for loans against shares and a significant boom in IPO financing activity.

items.title: India proposes easing aircraft leasing conditions in potential boost for IndiGo
